turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Endorsements in the 2016 Republican Party presidential primaries.
turn.1: What happened in the 2016 Republican Party presidential primaries?
turn.2: Endorsements in the 2016 Republican Party presidential primaries This is a list of notable political endorsements for declared candidates for the Republican primaries for the 2016 United States presidential election.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Endorsements are part of the "invisible primary" process, which occurs not only long before the general election in November 2016, but also largely occurs before even the caucuses and primaries have begun in February 2016.
turn.5: Is there anything else that happened after that?
turn.6: Early endorsements were correlated with the success candidates achieved in caucuses and primaries, for elections from 1980 through 2004.
turn.7: Did they have any other influences?
turn.8: Historically, there has been a correlation ("76% of the eventual vote percentage") between the percentage of political endorsements from sitting and former elected officials earned by a Republican candidate in the first half of the year prior to a presidential election (for the purposes of this article, January–June, 2015), with the percentage of votes cast for that candidate in Republican primaries during the first half of the election year (i.e., January–June, 2016). The value of political endorsements varies, depending on whom they are from, when they are given, and other factors.
turn.9: What other things did you find interesting?
turn.10: Endorsements from politicians who live in states with early primaries are highly sought after.
turn.12: So are endorsements from governors, federal senators, and federal representatives.
